title: Slaven Bilic adamant West Ham need to sign a striker amid Emmanuel Emenike talks
title_page: Slaven Bilic adamant West Ham need to sign a striker amid Emmanuel Emenike talks | Daily Mail Online
text:
Slaven Bilic admits West Ham United need to sign a striker this week and that they are in talks over a loan deal for Fenerbahce's Emmanuel Emenike.
West Ham face Liverpool in the FA Cup fourth round on Saturday with the London club looking to complete a hat-trick after already beating them twice this season.
The Hammers will be without the injured Andy Carroll and Diafra Sakho for the trip to Anfield and Bilic knows he needs to get a goalscorer to Upton Park as soon as possible.
Slaven Bilic, talking in a Thursday press conference, says West Ham United need to sign a striker this week
Bilic will be without the injured Andy Carroll and Diafra Sakho for his team's trip to Anfield on Saturday
Croatian manager Bilic gestures to his players during a training session in Chadwell Heath on Thursday
Frenchman Dimitri Payet stretches his right leg as a coach chats to him on a crisp day in east London
New full back signing from Leeds United Sam Byram stretches off while leaning against a team-mate
The 22-year-old scored three goals in 22 games for Leeds in the Championship before his move
'Yes we are still in the market,' Bilic said. 'We hope that both of our strikers (Carroll and Sakho) are going to be fit for the rest of the season. It' s looking good but not regarding the Liverpool game.
'Andy is going to be back in 10 days and Diafra two weeks.
'But we are looking to strengthen the squad on those positions.'
Asked about Emenike, who has been on loan at Dubai-based Al Ain recently, Bilic said: 'We are still waiting for that. It's a complicated situation.
'We made contact. They called me from the club and we spoke.
'We will see what is going to happen, whether it is going to be today, tomorrow, or not.'
Byram plays a right-footed pass (left), as New Zealand international defender Winston Reid (right) controls
Reid (right) points to fellow defender Joey O'Brien during practice ahead of the Liverpool match
(From left to right) James Tomkins, Reid, a West Ham coach and Nikica Jelavic go for a jog in training
Spanish goalkeeper Adrian, 29, tries a rabona kick while between the sticks at the session
West Ham have already recorded two wins against Liverpool this season but, despite going for a third, Bilic was not overly joyed to find out who his side had been drawn with in the FA Cup.
Bilic said: 'I didn't think, 'Oh yeah we beat them twice. Come on.' I thought, 'Why Liverpool?'
'It's Liverpool. But on the other hand we are confident because we did beat them twice. and we have a very recent memory of beating them. It's still here what we have to do.'
Emmanuel Emenike looks set for West Ham as talks with Fenerbahce about a loan deal are ongoing
